IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: ASSISTS THE MANHATTAN RETIREMENT FOUNDATION, INC.
IRS990.MissionDesc: THE MEADOWLARK HILLS FOUNDATION IS ORGANIZED FOR THE INVIOLABLE CHARITABLE PURPOSES OF: SOLICITING, RECEIVING, ACQUIRING, HOLDING, MAINTAINING, INVESTING AND REINVESTING MONEY AND/OR OTHER PROPERTY, AND FROM TIME TO TIME DISBURSING THE SAME AND/OR INCOME THEREFROM TO, OR FOR THE BENEFIT OF, MANHATTAN RETIREMENT FOUNDATION, INC. TO BE USED EXCLUSIVELY FOR THE CHARITABLE PURPOSES OF MANHATTAN RETIREMENT FOUNDATION, INC. ALSO, IT ASSISTS IN THE FINANCING OF THE FACILITY IN FURTHERANCE OF THE ORGANIZATION'S CHARITABLE PURPOSES AND MISSIONS.
IRS990.Desc: A NOT-FOR-PROFIT CHARITABLE ORGANIZATION, THE FOUNDATION IS DEDICATED TO THE CONTINUED GROWTH AND EXCELLENCE OF MEADOWLARK, BY PROVIDING OPPORTUNITIES FOR PRIVATE GIVING TO FURTHER THE PERSON-CENTERED MISSION OF MEADOWLARK HILLS RETIREMENT COMMUNITY. THROUGH THE GENEROSITY OF OUR RESIDENTS, THEIR LOVED ONES, AND MEMBERS OF THE LOCAL COMMUNITY, MEADOWLARK CREATES THE IRREPLACEABLE FEELING OF HOME. THESE SUPPORTERS, LIKE US, FEEL THAT THIS SUPPORTIVE, WELCOMING ENVIRONMENT IS ONE OF THE UTMOST PRIORITIES FOR OUR COMMUNITY AND OUR FUTURE.THE FOUNDATION'S WORK ALLOWS THE MEADOWLARK HILLS CAMPUS TO KEEP UP WITH CHANGING TECHNOLOGIES AND MODERN AMENITIES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE COLLECTION IS COMPRISED OF LOCAL AND REGIONAL ARTISTS. THE ART IS SELECTED BY A RESIDENT COMMITTEE AND IS THERE FOR THE ENJOYMENT OF THE RESIDENTS WHO LIVE AT THE RETIREMENT COMMUNITY.
THE INTENDED USE OF THE ENDOWMENT FUNDS IS TO PROVIDE CHARITABLE CARE TO RESIDENTS WHO HAVE USED ALL OF THEIR FINANCIAL RESOURCES.

THE ORGANIZATION'S INCOME TAX RETURNS ARE SUBJECT TO REVIEW AND EXAMINATION BY FEDERAL, STATE, AND LOCAL AUTHORITIES. THE ORGANIZATION IS NOT AWARE OF ANY ACTIVITIES THAT WOULD JEOPARDIZE ITS TAX-EXEMPT STATUS. THE ORGANIZATION IS NOT AWARE OF ANY ACTIVITIES THAT ARE SUBJECT TO TAX ON UNRELATED BUSINESS INCOME OR EXCISE OR OTHER TAXES.

RecipientTable.PurposeOfGrantTxt: TO PROVIDE FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE FOR RELATED ORGANIZATION.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FOUNDATION ENSURES GRANT FUNDS ARE USED TOWARDS ITS RELATED ENTITY'S PROGRAM SERVICES BY MONITORING EXPENSES BEFORE GRANT FUNDS ARE RELEASED.

A RELATED ORGANIZATION USES THE FOLLOWING METHODS TO ESTABLISH COMPENSATION OF THE CEO/EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR AND OTHER OFFICERS: COMPENSATION COMMITTEE, WRITTEN EMPLOYMENT CONTRACT, COMPENSATION SURVEY OR STUDY AND APPROVAL BY THE BOARD OR COMPENSATION COMMITTEE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 1A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE IS COMPOSED OF THE OFFICERS OF THE FOUNDATION. THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE MEETS AT THE CALL OF THE PRESIDENT OR ANY TWO OFFICERS TO CONDUCT THE AFFAIRS OF THE FOUNDATION BETWEEN MEETINGS OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS. ALL ACTION TAKEN BY THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE IS SUBJECT TO RATIFICATION BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 7A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS OF THE FOUNDATION ARE COMPOSED OF INDIVIDUALS APPOINTED TO MEMBERSHIP AND TO SERVE ON THE FOUNDATION'S BOARD BY THE BOARD OF MANHATTAN RETIREMENT FOUNDATION, INC., A RELATED ORGANIZATION.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 7B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES OF MANHATTAN RETIREMENT FOUNDATION, INC., MAY REMOVE ANY DIRECTOR FOR MISCONDUCT, MALFEASANCE IN OFFICE OR OTHER GOOD CAUSE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE GOVERNING BODY WILL REVIEW THE 990 AT A BOARD MEETING BEFORE IT IS FILED WITH THE IRS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ANNUAL CONFLICT DISCLOSURES ARE REVIEWED BY MANAGEMENT. ALL EMPLOYEES ARE ASKED TO SIGN A CONFLICT OF INTEREST DISCLOSURE ON AN ANNUAL BASIS. IF AN EMPLOYEE INVOLVED IN MAKING DECISIONS ON BEHALF OF THE ORGANIZATION IS DETERMINED TO HAVE A CONFLICT, THEY DO NOT PARTICIPATE IN DECISIONS REGARDING BUSINESS TRANSACTIONS WITH THE PARTY IN INTEREST.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FOUNDATION DIRECTOR'S SALARY IS DETERMINED BY THE CEO OF THE MANHATTAN RETIREMENT FOUNDATION, INC. THE FINANCE DIRECTOR'S SALARY IS DETERMINED BY THE CEO OF THE MANHATTAN RETIREMENT FOUNDATION, INC. THE FOUNDATION DIRECTOR AND FINANCE DIRECTOR ARE THE ONLY OFFICERS OR KEY EMPLOYEES OF THE ORGANIZATION. THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES DETERMINES THE SALARY FOR THE CEO. ALL OF THE OTHER DIRECTOR POSITIONS ARE SET BY THE CEO. THE PERSONNEL COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES REVIEWS SALARIES BY POSITIONS AS REQUESTED. THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES APPROVES THE SALARIES AND WAGES IN TOTAL FOR THE ORGANIZATION THROUGH THE APPOVAL OF THE ANNUAL OPERATING BUDGET. ALL TOP MANAGEMENT OFFICIALS AND KEY EMPLOYEES ARE PAID BY A RELATED ORGANIZATION, MANHATTAN RETIREMENT FOUNDATION, INC.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION WILL PROVIDE A COPY OF THE FORM 990 TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST. ALSO, THE AUDITED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE PUBLISHED IN THE ANNUAL REPORT, WHICH IS AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST.
EQUITY TRANSFER TO RELATED PARTY 134,479. CHANGE IN VALUE OF CHARITABLE REMAINDER TRUST 22,795.
THIS PROCESS IS CONSISTENT WITH THE PRIOR YEAR.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PAGES 7 & 8, PART VII AND FORM 990, PAGE 10, PART IX, LINE 5
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: REPORTED SALARY EXPENSE - WHILE A RELATED ENTITY ISSUES THE W-2S FOR THE OFFICERS LISTED, THE FILING ENTITY RECORDS AND REPORTS THE SALARY EXPENSE OF THESE OFFICERS.
